title: Importance of Morning Sadhana | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: Chanting sixteen rounds every day is like building a dam across your past karma.
segments.summary: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa emphasizes the importance of morning sadhana, especially chanting, as a means to counter past karma and disturbances in Krishna consciousness.
segments.transcript: Just because you have come to the shelter of Prabhupada, you have joined this gun movement, Prabhupada's movement. Please always remember, according to Kala, our karma is continuously unfolding. Whether it is maybe sickness or mental disturbance or this and that and all. And that will disturb your Krishna consciousness practice. Chanting sixteen rounds every day is like building a dam across your past karma. You can have a peaceful spiritual life. Not only chanting sixteen rounds. Morning sadhana full if you do. You are completely insulated from all kinds of so many sins we have done in our past lives. That tendency is there. Vasana is there. Force is there. Sense gratification is there. All that will all harass. Senses will come and disturb. All these things. All those things can be countered if you have a very strict sadhana. Very strict sadhana. Till ten o'clock, nine o'clock, till class is over, just focus on this sadhana.
